context: New strategies use high doses of PPI to avoid rebleeding in acute phase. Therefore, early and exact diagnosis of H. pylori in the acute phase of bleeding is important to detect the maximum number of patients who could benefit from eradication therapy. Recent data suggest a low diagnostic accuracy of RUT in bleeding ulcers [8–10]. The aim of our study was to determine the diagnostic accuracy of the RUT in patients with ulcer hemorrhage compared to patients with uncomplicated duodenal or gastric ulcers, using histology and 13C-urea breath test (UBT) as references. Patient recruitment and matching From January 1999 to November 2000, all consecutive patients with endoscopically proven ulcer hemorrhage were considered. Emergency EGD was usually performed within 8 h after admission. All patients without PPI or antibiotics 10 days before admission were enrolled in the study.
